paragraph.htmltext:
Note 1: Damaged components and waste cannot be transported by plan.

Note 2: The legislation and regulation of transporting Lithium-ion batteries by plane is changing rapidly. It is therefore recommended that when it is planned to tranport components by plane, the latest regulations are verified.

This transportation contains the following steps:

  • Transporting the components over road to the airport.
  • Possible storage of the components at the airport
  • Transporting the components by ship to destination airport
  • It is possible that the components are stored in the destination airport
  • Transporting the component to the final destination by land transport

For the land transport from the sender to the airport and the airport to the receiver, the ADR is applicable. This implies that the transporter need to comply with the ADR regulation and that an ADR transport document shall be available.

When the components are placed into storage in the harbour, appropriate action shall be taken to avoid sever incidents due to thermal reactions in the components.
